title: Power ministry may refuse World Bank's coal transition fund plan
description: The power ministry in India is unlikely to participate in the World Bank's accelerated coal transition investment plan, which aims to facilitate a move away from coal. The ministry's stance is due to the increasing energy demand in the country and the need to ensure capacity availability. Power Minister RK Singh has previously stated that India requires an additional 25-30 GW of thermal capacity, with most of it expected to come from coal-based units.
